fields.description:
After adding the "Component Lead" on to the Notifications, we noticed that email messages ceased to be sent out and that we had hundreds of messages on the Error Queue.  Upon investigation, it turned out that the emails were failing due to a NullPointerException.  Removing the Component Lead from the notification allowed the email to be sent.

I think the error occurs if there is no component lead specified, but I am not positive.

Attached is a patch that should resolve the issue.
fields.summary: Email failing when using "Notify Component Lead

fields.summary: NullPointerException in CookieUtils

fields.description:
Some users have multiple e-mail addresses / aliases, e.g. j.brown@example.com, james.brown@example.com etc.
Still it is the same person, who has one JIRA account. 
But the comment is created automatically only if the e-mail comes from the address listed in JIRA.

I think it would be a good idea to define an entire list of user's e-mail addresses. One of the addresses would be the main one. 
Other would exist to better idetify the user for the automatic issue / comment creation purpose.
fields.summary: Multiple e-mail addresses of the same user and automatic issue / comment creation
Sort users and groups when editing permission scheme

fields.description:
To change the field description of a entry field individuell for different projects the standard way is to change the field description in a project related field configuration (I did so for the standard field 'Description'). But I have no chance to do this fo a self created custom field (in this trial for a single select field type). When I change the field description in a specific field configuration, the description then changes also in all other exisiting field descriptions and therefore the changed desciption is displayed in ALL projects and not only in the specific project.

A cross-check in the other field configurations confirmed my initial assumption. As already mentioned above it works for the JIRA standard fields 'Description' and 'Environment' but not for the custom fields. I hope this is just an issue and not the default behavior in JIRA.
fields.summary: Changing field descriptions in "Field Configurations" for custom fields does not work

fields.description: If a EOF character (hex 0x1a) is in an issue comment, the RSS output used by Confluence becomes invalid (it contains &#026).
fields.summary: Charcter 0x1a in JIRA comment produces invalid RSS output

fields.description: We would like to be able to use the "watched issue" as a filter predicate. For instance, create a filter displaying all the issues watched by the current user which are unresolved.
fields.summary: Ability to use the watched issue as a filter predicate

fields.description:
Sorting of comments (ascending, descending) is a nice feature, but if a user always wishes to see comments sorted in descending order, this has to be selected each time the user logs into JIRA.

Suggestion: add a sorting option to the users preferences, so that it is up to the user to select the order.
fields.summary: Let users select the comment sort order
Improperly encoded user name when creating new user

fields.description:
Customer asked "Is it possible to control which users a particular user can assign bugs to?".

This would be possible if we could break the assignable user list down to the group level. This would allow a set of assignable users to be associated with one or mutliple groups.
fields.summary: Add Group Level control to assignable user security level permission

fields.description: For some reason, 'delete' is alongside the security level name, instead of in the Operations column. It should probably be on the far right of the operations (ie. _not_ right next to 'Add', but still in the correct column). See the screenshot.
fields.summary: UI bug: when editing security levels, 'delete' is in wrong place

fields.description:
h4.Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt to change any fields of a closed bug.  

h4.Expected Results
* Edit issue option is available for convenience 
* Bulk edit operations available for closed bugs 

h4.Actual Results
* Must first reopen the bug 

It would be nice if this wasn't a two step process.
fields.summary: Not possible to edit closed bugs without reopening
Lock user profile

fields.description:
Bugzilla importer allows project to use project key that already exists in JIRA. It's not totally a bad thing because it allows issues to be inserted into an existing project, I guess. But it does not look right if a project is created with existing project key.

See: [JSP-5863|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-5863]
fields.summary: Bugzilla Importer allows same project key

fields.description:
The way that attachments are ordered in JIRA is very confusing.

In spite of what JIRA-8842 says, they are not ordered by date.

As far as I can tell they are ordered by descending order of date within ascending order of filename.
I can't see the point of including the file name in the order, unless there is a strict naming convention for attachments.

Furthermore, the only way to tie the attachment comments to the attachment is via the date.
The attachment comment does not appear in the attachment screen, and the attachment name (or link) does not automatically get added to the comment, as for example is done in Bugzilla.

This all makes it hard work to use attachments.
fields.summary: Attachment ordering

fields.description:
Currently the following views are hard-coded:

Single Issue
- XML
- Word

Search Request
- Full content
- XML
- Printable
- Word
- Excel (some fields | all fields)

Other views that could be useful include a PDF view, or 'RSS' view that included the body of the issue in the RSS feed (a big improvement on our current RSS feeds).

By making it pluggable, users could plug in their own versions.
fields.summary: Make 'views' of content (single issue and search request) pluggable, and rewrite default implementations in velocity

fields.description:
We are using JIRA as a customer service tool for a small department.... and the intent is for us to manage the amount of time they the work inhouse vs the amount of time the work is at an external party.  

We do not create 1 ticket per request, we create a ticket, put it in progess and then resolve it.  At which point it could be reopened and the resolved, over and over again depending on how many times the same request comes back in to our department.  The ticket is closed after we are certain the ticket can not be reopened.

Is there a way to report on this captured history?  If I resolve a ticket 3 times in 1 hour, it is recorded as being resolved only 1 time.

We would also like to know the total amount of time a ticket is in progress given the model I explained above.
fields.summary: Ability to report on the States

fields.description:
For instance, try to [search jira.a.c for ">="|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/QuickSearch.jspa?searchString=JRA%20%22%3E%3D%22]. This issue doesn't come up in the results.

More generally, searching for any non-alphanumeric character (!@#$%^ etc) does not work, even if quoted or escaped. I think this is because we don't index 'words' containing these in Lucene.
fields.summary: Cannot search for non-alphanumeric strings like ">="

fields.description:
When you select Issue Links, you see a list (table) of issues which are linked. 

There's an icon, issue id, summary etc. If you configure jira.table.cols.linkedissue e.g. like this:

jira.table.cols.linkedissue = issuetype, issuekey, summary, status, priority, fixVersions, description, duedate, assignee, reporter

Then it is not always obvious what information is shown in the various columns. Then it would be nice to have headlines.

What it looks like today:

Cloners 
This issue has clones:

| PETERB-1 |  Summary of the problem |  Open |   |  1.0 |  A description of the problem  | |  Peter Brandström |  Peter Brandström 
| PETERB-2 |  CLONE -Summary of the problem  | Open |   |  1.0 |  A description of the problem  |  | Peter Brandström |  Peter Brandström 

What would be nice:

Cloners 
This issue has clones:

|| issuekey  || summary  || status ||  priority ||  fixVersions ||  description ||  duedate ||  assignee ||  reporter 
| PETERB-1 |  Summary of the problem |  Open |   |  1.0 |  A description of the problem  | |  Peter Brandström |  Peter Brandström 
| PETERB-2 |  CLONE -Summary of the problem  | Open |   |  1.0 |  A description of the problem  | |  Peter Brandström |  Peter Brandström
fields.summary: Column headings for linked issues table

An operation ie "insert hyperlink" where the user browses to the destination file (noting this ideally should be available when adding a comment along with other text). It might need a shortcut key or something?
fields.summary: Ability to browse a network file and create a hyperlink to the chosen file

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10383].
  {panel}


If the backup directory does not exist, the backup service fails. Even though there is a warning in JIRA's log file, I don't find this sufficient for such an important functionality.

I would suggest the following important improvement:
Make Jira create the directory if it does not exist. 
If unable to create the directory, generate an email warning to the jira administrators in order to have the problem identified and fixed.

As everybody knows, having a backup may be crucial for if you experience a harddrive failure........

I found a quite similar request JRA-7912 where another backup failure is discussed, though I want to adress the directory problem specifically as this can be easily fixed (simply creating the directory will in most cases fix the problem).
fields.summary: Backup service fails if backup directory does not exist
Workflow transition screens: allow definition of mandatory fields, defaults and descriptions here as well

fields.description:
The view issue screen is supposed to show all the system fields no matter how the screen configuration is setup. At the moment if you have a ViewIssueScreen configured that does not include the environment field then the value will not be displayed because there is no FieldScreenLayoutItem for that field. We should make it so that we render the value even if there is no FieldScreenLayoutItem for the field. You can find data that will allow you to reproduce this here:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-5376
  The call is happening in the viewissue.jsp where it calls through to the action to getFieldScreenRenderLayoutItem for the field. The default return value of this function, a FieldScreenRenderLayoutItemImpl without a FieldScreenLayoutItem will never display the value.
fields.summary: We need to rework the view issue page to render the description and environment fields without depending on the FieldScreenLayoutItem
Ability to automatically create an issue or sub-task based upon specified criteria

fields.description: Whenever an email is with a graphic image embadded into the email body and the email is directed into Jira system, the text in the email body is not updated to Jira as a comment. All the text within the body of the email which should be the issue comment is lost.
fields.summary: Lose text of email sent into Jira if email has embedded graphic image with body of text

fields.description: Due to JRA-9492, it is not possible to import data using Jetty. We need to doc this.
fields.summary: Document the Jetty Import problem

fields.description:
I want to manage incoming sale request from JIRA.
Until now, ticket coming to the sale alias were created as "anonymous" user. The result is that I must answer with the email address included in the ticket and CC the sales alias to track the answer in Jira. If the customer answer to me only and do not CC the sales alias, his answer is not tracked.

A solution to his problem is to automatically create its account. We can then answer / comment the ticket directly and the customer cannot reply to me directly and is forced to use Jira.
It is not however possible to decide in which user group the user will be automatically created by the CreateIssueHandler. It is thus not possible to periodically look at this group to delete inappropriate users.

I have played with the "Jira user" field in the global permission. However, as all user have to be in this group to be able to sign in, you cannot do a query to sort out the user that have automatically been created.

This is a very important need and I feel the addition would be quite straightforward.
fields.summary: CreateIssueHandler: Add a group creation option to decide in which group the user will be automatically created

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10364].
  {panel}

To assist with many different use cases, most noteably, allowing all users from a single customer to be able to easily sign up to JIRA and then see and comment on all the issues created by the colleagues we need: 'Dynamic Groups'.

The Dynamic Group will allow one or multiple domain names to be associated with it.

E.G. A JIRA Administrator wants to ensure that any users from their customer Domain that sign up to JIRA are automatically included in a group that has been setup for the company Domain which has permissions to view certain issues and projects. To do this:

1. A Dynamic Group called 'Domain' would be setup with two domains defined: domain.com, sub.domain.com.  

2. Then when a user signs up to JIRA, if their email address features domain.com or sub.domain.com they will automatically be added to the 'Domain' group. 

3. All Domain employees that sign up to JIRA will therefore automatically be allowed to see all Domain accessible JIRA content (dictated by Permissions and Issue Security Levels which refer to the group Domain).
fields.summary: Create dynamic groups - groups that automatically add users based on domain name of user's email address

fields.description:
We need an upgrade task to remove all recoreds that have a NULL username from the MEMBERSHIPBASE table. There should very rarely be any.

However, a few customers have NULL usernames in the membershipbase table, ultimately resulting in v3.6.1 and v3.6.2 as JRA-10304. It seems earlier versions of JIRA didn't mind NULL so much. So far it the root cause has not been found.

Customers have generally been those upgrading from a previous version and they report that they deleted the users in question using the admin interface (as opposed to directly in the database or via import/export) so it is possible that a past version of JIRA did not clean up during deletions. 

IF we ever find any records in membershipbase like this in a version after this upgrade task, we will know that version has the bug of not deleting users correctly. (or customers are using SQL to delete!)
fields.summary: Upgrade Task for removing records with to null usernames in the membershipbase table
Diagramatic representation of Jira data model should be included in documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10361].
  {panel}

Occasionally it would convenient to point casual users to JIRA to create issues, but the one doesn't want to surrounding complexity of JIRA to distract users. Irrelevant complexity might include:
 - Project and Issue type - these would probably be preselected for users.
 - Standard JIRA headers and menus. Eg. the 'Home' and 'Find Issues' tabs at the top. We want users to see _only_ things relevant to creating an issue.
 - JIRA user registration. It should be possible for users to enter just their name/email address, and optionally their password, entered in the same form that the issue is created in.
 - Custom 'thankyou' screen after issue creation. After creating the issue, it should be possible to send users to a custom screen, rather than dumping them back in the standard JIRA interface.
fields.summary: Support for simplified custom issue creation screens

fields.description:
A developer may have many issues assigned to them.  It would be nice if they could assign a priority code to them that indicated, within the list of open issues they had, the order in which they intended to take them.  This could be accompiled with a custom field however there are some special rules which would have to be implemented.

They could assign only sequencial numbers starting with 1.  So, for example, They assign an issue a code of 1, then another the code of 2, etc.

If they close or reassign an issue, all higher number codes are reset to the next lower number.  So, if they close *#2*, then *#3* becomes *#2* etc.  This assures that all open issues that have a number are sequencial from 1..N

If there are N issues asssigned priorities 1..N and they assign an issue, not in that set, to priority 1<m<N, then all issue with priority greater than m are incremented. There are thus N+1 issues with sequential priority.


If an issue is reassigned or closed, its priority code is nulled out.

All this this would allow, at a quick glance, a person to see in what order a developer had intended to work on a set of issues.  Had the user entered some kind of estimatedDays, a person could get an quick estimate of when the issue that they cared about would be done.

Could we get this done on a consulting basis for a fee if it is not in the roadmap?
fields.summary: developer priority with special rules

fields.description:
SOAP messages are notoriously large.  To help reduce the transport overhead, the soap messages should be GZip encoded (if requested by the client).  A simple test on getProjects reduced the payload from about 32655 to 2324 bytes.  Smaller messages are far less dramatic.

All that should be required to get gzip compression is to add this to the web.xml:
    <filter-mapping>
        <filter-name>gzip</filter-name>
        <url-pattern>/rpc/*</url-pattern>
    </filter-mapping>
fields.summary: Enable GZip compression on SOAP interface

fields.description:
I was trying to login to a new instance of JIRA and I noticed a mistake in the error message displayed when trying to retrieve your username. 

To retrieve a username, the system asks for an _email address_. 

If the email address is not found the error message reads: "No user with that username exists". 

The error message should read "No user with that email address exists."
fields.summary: Incorrect error message on ForgotUserNames.jspa - refers to user name rather than email address

fields.description:
Hey folks, around 2003 somebody figured out the Browser can sort a table orders of magnitude faster than doing server round trips. Especially useful with large issues lists, or on a hard hit server, or when bandwidth stream is less than 100 Mbps (ex. over VPN in an airport or hotel)

I keep hoping sortable magic will appear in Jira without having to ask... but...uh, no.

*Is client-side sorting at least on the roadmap?*

Some potential implementations:
* http://www.scbr.com/docs/products/dhtmlxGrid/index.shtml
* http://www.activewidgets.com/grid/
* http://webfx.eae.net/dhtml/sortabletable/sortabletable.html
* http://kryogenix.org/code/browser/sorttable/
* http://friedcellcollective.net/js/SortedTable/
fields.summary: Client-Side table sorting magic

fields.description:
After using my custom Issue Types for a while, I decided to change the icons from the generic icon to another gif file.
After changing the icon, all custom fields bound by the context of the Issue Types, were no longer displayed on the different screens (create, view and so on)

Other custom fields used in other projects that were not using the mentioned Issue Types were still displayed correctly.

A restart of JIRA made all the custom fields appear again.

Though I did perform other administrative tasks at the same point in time, it looks like the problem is directly linked to the editing of the Issue Type, since other projects not using the edited Issue Types still worked fine.
fields.summary: After changing the icon on a custom Issue Type, related custom fields disappeared from the different screens

fields.description:
For users with large cvs logs (e.g. https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-4781) the cvs indices can take a long time to create. During this time, the CVS tab displays a message which suggests the user go to the admin panel and "hasten" things along. 

The message should read something along the lines of "The CVS indices are currently being rebuilt and cvs log information will be available when this process completes."
fields.summary: Display specific message when CVS indexes are being created.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10333].
  {panel}

We have extended yours jira-rpc-plugin with possibility to   retrieving issue change history (see: http://jira.atlassian.com/  browse/JRA-9533) and because of that I have a question. It is   possible to include our changes in offical plugin release? It   will be a great benefit for possible customers not to install our   custom version of this plugin, but the original one. If it will   be possible, could you please contact me with a person to whom I   may send plugin source code changes. 

Best Regards,
Robert Sermak
Parasoft Corp.
www.parasoft.com

Hi Robert,

Thanks for offering to contribute! Just send your changes to me,   and I'll forward them on to the JIRA team so that they can look   over them. Hopefully we'll be able  to get them into the RPC   plugin soon. 

Cheers,
Jonathan


Hello Jonathan,

As I promised in attachment you can find changed version of rpc-  plugin and diff file. So, now with this changes new method is available in soap   interface: getChangeHistory, also two new beans has been introduced: RemoteChangeHistory and   RemoteChangeItem (take a look below for full list of changes or to attached diff file). Sad information   is that I've made only necessary changes from our point of view.   So, I did not add any unit tests and I did not change any part of   code responsible for xml-rpc. There is one thing more, because I   did not write any Jira plugin before, and I do not know Jira code very well I strongly recommend that someone   should review my changes before including them in main branch. Especially  I'm not sure  if   I have included all necessary fields in RemoteChangeHistory and in RemoteChangeItem bean. 

Finally, we'd really appreciate if someone let us know (if it is   not a problem of course) when we may expect official plugin   release. Thank you very much for all. 

Best Regards,
Robert Sermak
Parasoft Corp.
www.parasoft.com
fields.summary: Review and integrate contributed RPC changes

fields.description:
The CSV importer allows you to map a field to a "New custom field", whose type is then chosen from a drop-down list. This list has a limited selection of types:

!http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/images/docs/config/csv-field2.png!

One type missing, which could be very useful, is the "Import Id" custom field type. 'Import Id' fields display as a URL in the 'view issue' page, and just as a number in the edit page.

Of course, it's always possible to first create the 'Import Id' custom field and then specify 'Existing custom field' in the CSV import wizard.

fields.description:
Team:

Does JIRA have the ability to define new customized permissions within the Permission schema? 

We are looking to expore 2 areas:
1. To define new permissions (with or without an action) within the permission schema that is applied to the project.
or
2. To create a permission action which defines a particular issue type.
For example: To create a permission called "Release", and apply it to Issue Type "Release". Now only users with permission to "Release" will be able to work or create an issue against issue type "Release".

Your prompt response is much appreciated.

Regards,
Amrita
fields.summary: Ability to define a new customized permissions within the Permission schema...

fields.description:
A lot of static pages aren't being cached because they are set to expire immidiatly in the http header.

For example, when I try to open this page
GET http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-9448 HTTP/1.0 => HTTP/1.1 200 OK [1.453 s]

these 6 files are all set to expire immediately which forces the browser to get them for every issue I request.

GET http://jira.atlassian.com/styles/combined-printable.css HTTP/1.0 => HTTP/1.1 304 Not Modified [0.312 s]
GET http://jira.atlassian.com/styles/combined.css HTTP/1.0 => HTTP/1.1 304 Not Modified [0.438 s]
GET http://jira.atlassian.com/includes/js/combined-javascript.js HTTP/1.0 => HTTP/1.1 304 Not Modified [0.266 s]
GET http://jira.atlassian.com/includes/js/calendar/calendar.js HTTP/1.0 => HTTP/1.1 304 Not Modified [0.687 s]
GET http://jira.atlassian.com/includes/js/calendar/lang/calendar-en.js HTTP/1.0 => HTTP/1.1 304 Not Modified [0.438 s]
GET http://jira.atlassian.com/includes/js/calendar/calendar-setup.js HTTP/1.0 => HTTP/1.1 304 Not Modified [0.391 s]

So basicly each request is taking 4 seconds and 60 % of the time is wasted on retrieving Not Modified responses

see also latest comments for JRA-9448

This makes jira almost useless on really slow network
fields.summary: JIRAs HTTP transfers are not efficient - improve web performance

fields.description:
At the moment the plugin is shipped as a simple jar file, which is missing the external jars the plugin depends on (e.g. the class: net/fortuna/ical4j/model/ValidationException). So the plugin does not work when deployed.

I guess we need to ship a zip where all the jars are contained, and tell users to place all jars in the zip into JIRA's WEB-INF/lib directory.
fields.summary: Bundle JIRA Calendar plugin correctly.

fields.description:
A custom field not associated to a project (via screen) is presented when the project is selected.

I understand from Jira support that the project / screen associations won't take affect unless you explicitly 
context that custom field to those projects using those screen schemes.

To me, this logic isn't correct.

If a custom field is associated to a project, but is not added to the screen(s) associated to the project, that field won't be used for that project, and hence, should not have anything to search for against the selected project and shouldn't be presented at all.

In my implementation, I have created many custom fields which are open to all projects; but I confine what fields to be used for which project by associating the custom fields to screens.

Currently, if I need the fields to be presently correctly at filtering, I need to recontext the fields to the specific projects.  But that also means if I add a new project using an already defined screen, I also need to update the field to associate to this project.  Imagine I have 20 custom fields for a project using the screen with these 20 custom fields defined.  I am set to make mistakes that way.

The logic would be to take into consideration the screens associated with the projects selected in filtering, and recalculate the search menu.  Only taking projects into account (besides issue types) is not sufficient; must include screens as a factor as well.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Fields presented for filtering should be tied to projects and screens associated with the project(s) selected

fields.description:
In the current version of JIRA development kit (3.6-1) the rpc-client-sample-plugin (found in the examples/rpc-client-sample-plugin directory) has the following files which I believe should not be there:

src/etc/atlassian-plugin.xml
src/java/Java source goes here.java

This example is a sample XML-RPC client, which is not a JIRA plugin and hence should not need the atlassian-plugin.xml file. The atlassian-plugin.xml file is actually invalid, e.g. the "key" ayyribute is set to "com.atlassian.jira.plugin.???".

I think it is also a good idea to rename the directory to rpc-client-sample (remove "-plugin" from its name), as the example is not a plugin.

As far as I can see, the src/java/Java source goes here.java file is also not needed, as it does not serve any purpose.
fields.summary: Invalid files in jira-development-kit

fields.description:
Create two issues with estimates of 1 hour each. Spend 30 minutes on one and 90 minutes on the other.
Now resolve and close both (this should imply that work is finished, right?).
The Time Tracking report now will show that we're 30 minutes behind the estimated schedule.

Workaround: when setting the "remaining estimate" to 0 for the "good" issue, the gain will be displayed on the report.
fields.summary: on the Time Tracking report, estimate accuracy is always <= 0. Gains on the estimates are displayed as 0

fields.description:
